column3: If I'm not mistaken, `contrib/zmq/zmq_sub.py` has the wrong file permissions; changed them to `755`.
How are we stil finding http links in the repository in the year 2020 :sweat_smile:

Thanks for fixing @jonatack! :)

---

Aside:

A `scripted-diff` might be needed to bring the remaining old school style links to year 2020 :)

```
$ git grep 'http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php' | wc -l
1092
```

Bonus points if we can remove the external -- and thus potentially changing -- reference to simply referencing the `COPYING` file. That would get
True :dango: :icecream:  though updating all those links isn't really in the scope of this patch. I actually only noticed the http url just before opening it. :shipit:

Ahhhhh updating 1002 files sounds … pretty awful … that fully answers my question though. Together with XML schemas and such it makes it hard to search for relevant ones. \nAgree it's out of scope of this PR, if worthwhile at all (not sure anymroe).
